qas.question: What business provides banking services on Tuvalu?
What percentage of the Tuvalu workforce is in the public sector?
Where are many of those who provide income to residents earning?
How do 15% of male Tuvaluans earn their income?
What are the traditional forms of living employed by Tuvaluans?

context: Banking services are provided by the <a0_0>National Bank of Tuvalu<a0_0/>. Public sector workers make up about <a1_0>65%<a1_0/> of those formally employed. Remittances from Tuvaluans living in Australia and New Zealand, and remittances from Tuvaluan sailors employed on <a2_0>overseas<a2_0/> ships are important sources of income for Tuvaluans. Approximately 15% of adult males work as <a3_0>seamen<a3_0/> on foreign-flagged merchant ships. Agriculture in Tuvalu is focused on coconut trees and growing pulaka in large pits of composted soil below the water table. Tuvaluans are otherwise involved in traditional subsistence <a4_0>agriculture and fishing.
